00050 /*  Dance around the compiler to figure out  */
00051 /*  if we have access to function macro...   */
00052 
00053 /*  If we have gnu -- Yes!!  */
00054 #if defined(__GNUC__)
00055     /*  We get a really nice function macro  */
00056 #   define NativeLayer_func__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
00057 #elif defined(WIN32) && (_MSC_VER >= 1300)
00058 #   define NativeLayer_func__ __FUNCSIG__
00059 /*  Otherwise, lets look for C99 compatibility  */
00060 #elif defined (__STDC_VERSION__)
00061     /*  The above line may not be necessary but   */
00062     /*  Im not about to find out...               */
00063     /*  Check to see if the compiler is doing C99 */
00064 #   if __STDC_VERSION__ < 199901
00065         /*  If not, define an empty function signature  */
00066 #       define NativeLayer_func__ ""
00067 #   else
00068         /*  If so -- Yes!! Use it!  */
00069 #       define NativeLayer_func__ __func__
00070 #   endif
00071 #else
00072 /*  If STDC stuff isnt defined, that would be lame, but  */
00073 /*  lets make sure its still okay                        */
00074 #   define NativeLayer_func__ ""
00075 #endif
00076

00084 #  include <process.h>

00205     inline void byteSwap(sys::byte *buffer,
00206                          const unsigned short elemSize,
00207                          const size_t numElems)
00208     {
00209         if (!buffer || elemSize < 2 || !numElems)
00210             return;
00211 
00212         unsigned short half = elemSize >> 1;
00213         long offset = 0, innerOff = 0, innerSwap = 0;
00214 
00215         for(size_t i = 0; i < numElems; ++i, offset += elemSize)
00216         {
00217             for(unsigned short j = 0; j < half; ++j)
00218             {
00219                 innerOff = offset + j;
00220                 innerSwap = offset + elemSize - 1 - j;
00221                 
00222                 sys::byte tmp       = buffer[innerOff];
00223                 buffer[innerOff]    = buffer[innerSwap];
00224                 buffer[innerSwap]   = tmp;
00225             }
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00249     template <typename T> T byteSwap(T val)
00250     {
00251         size_t size = sizeof(T);
00252         T out;
00253         
00254         unsigned char* cOut = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&out);
00255         unsigned char* cIn = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&val);
00256         for (int i = 0, j = size - 1; i < j; ++i, --j)
00257         {
00258             cOut[i] = cIn[j];
00259             cOut[j] = cIn[i];
00260         }
00261         return out;
00262     }
